claim.text: Combining tabular data from financial documents with text transcripts and audio recordings improves stock volatility and price movement prediction by 5-12%
claim.exact_quote: In this work, we show that combining tabular data from financial semi-structured documents with text transcripts and audio recordings not only improves stock volatility and price movement prediction by 5-12%

evidence.evidence_text: Tables 3 and 4 show 8-12% gains in performance for both volatility and price movement prediction tasks across models when adding DocEmbedding
evidence.limitations: Results only shown for two specific datasets
evidence.exact_quote: We observe significant gains (8-12%) in both tasks across attention based (MDRM, VoLTAGE, MMFTR) and Transformer models (M3A)

conclusion.limitations: Results based on specific datasets and models, may not generalize to all financial contexts

claim.text: The approach reduces gender bias caused by audio-based neural networks by over 30%
claim.exact_quote: but also reduces gender bias caused due to audio-based neural networks by over 30%

evidence.evidence_text: Table 6 demonstrates reduction in gender bias metrics when using tabular data vs audio
evidence.limitations: Exact 30% reduction not explicitly shown in numbers
evidence.exact_quote: Audio modality has consistently higher error individually as well as in combination with either of the other modalities, while it significantly drops when considering just text and table data

conclusion.limitations: The 30% reduction figure is not clearly demonstrated in Table 6, which only shows relative differences in error metrics

claim.text: Substituting company filings data instead of audio input along with text transcripts maintains model performance while reducing gender bias
claim.exact_quote: utilizing text transcripts with table data from financial documents instead of its audio counterpart does not deteriorate the model performance

evidence.evidence_text: Table 5 shows similar performance when using text+table vs text+audio+table
evidence.exact_quote: Green shade highlights that substituting company filings instead of its audio counterpart inconjunction with text transcripts does not significantly deteriorate model performance

conclusion.limitations: Limited to specific model architectures and datasets tested, needs broader validation

claim.text: Replacing audio clips with tabular data reduces data processing time and storage requirements by over 90% and 50% respectively
claim.exact_quote: Replacing audio clips with tabular data leads to a reduction of data processing time and data storage requirements by over 90% and 50%, respectively for both MAEC and M&A datasets

evidence.evidence_text: Explicit statement of processing and storage reductions
evidence.limitations: Method for calculating reductions not detailed
evidence.exact_quote: Replacing audio clips with tabular data leads to a reduction of data processing time and data storage requirements by over 90% and 50%, respectively for both MAEC and M&A datasets

conclusion.limitations: No empirical evidence or measurements provided to support specific percentage claims

claim.text: The method shows significant gains of 8-12% across attention based and Transformer models for both volatility and price movement prediction tasks
claim.exact_quote: We observe significant gains (8-12%) in both tasks across attention based (MDRM, VoLTAGE, MMFTR) and Transformer models (M3A)

evidence.evidence_text: Tables 3 and 4 demonstrate performance gains across model types
evidence.exact_quote: We observe significant gains (8-12%) in both tasks across attention based (MDRM, VoLTAGE, MMFTR) and Transformer models (M3A)

conclusion.limitations: Results specific to tested models and datasets, may vary with different implementations
